page.title: 01ASHBY DE LA ZOUCH
page.content: This ancient Market Town on the borders of the counties of Leicestershire and Derbyshire is the centre of main roads leading to most of the towns and cities of the Midlands. It is expanding steadily,and has a population of 11,500.Ashby is the second largest town in North West Leicestershire.The houses in Market Street,which is the towns principal shopping area are old half timbered buildings. The name{"ASHBY"}derived from the Saxon word "aesc" which means "ash", and from the Saxon word "byr" which means a habitation.Alain de Parrhoet la souche gave Ashby the suffix{"LA {ZOUCH"}in about 1160,when he inherited this position by marriage.
